ygData.subject: Re: EverQuest -- It is an RPG!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: What does any of this have to do with magic? ... the game was to enhance the RPG experience.  It isn t all supposed to be, who can make the most money the
ygData.messageBody:
What does any of this have to do with magic?

At 12:06 PM 5/11/99 -0400, you wrote:
>From: Peanut <peanut@...>
>
>On 11 May 1999 duffjc@... wrote:
>
>> From: duffjc@...
>>
>> I don't want to get anyone mad at me but,
>> this is an RPG. ROLE PLAYING GAME!!!! The reason skills where put in
the game was to enhance the RPG experience. It isn't all supposed to be,
who can make the most money the fastest with the highest lvl.
>>
>> Skills are not utterly pointless. They allow you to emerge yourself
into your character without the constant: You hit a gnoll for 14 damage.
>> for 10 hours a session. I know some skills cost more than you get out
of them, but think of it as a gaming dynamics. It is supposed to be FUN
guys. If your not having fun, don't play.
>>
>> Sorry if I affended anyone, but I needed to vent an this situation. It
seems everyone has something bad to say.
>>
>
>I agree that role-playing is the heart of the game. But I have to keep
>asking myself: "Why would my character spend all of his money developing a
>trade that provides no benefit?"
>
>I mean, aren't trade skills supposed to represent _jobs_ in EQ? If so,
>wouldn't you expect to _make_ money by using them? If the skill was
>"Throwing money into the water" (something to practice while fishing, I
>guess), I would expect that the skill would provide no benefit, and
>my character would develop it for some other reason (perhaps, because he
>is a loony).
>
>I see no inconsistency in being a true role-player and whining about the
>fact that you make no money by <insert trade skill>. IRL, I whine that
>the jobs I'd like to have don't pay enough. So, why shouldn't my
>character complain, ESPECIALLY when the skill makes him no money at all?
>
>-Peanut
